newsitem.title: USA: Judge puts off FDA-tobacco ruling to April 14.
newsitem.headline: Judge puts off FDA-tobacco ruling to April 14.

text.p: The federal judge weighing a tobacco industry court challenge to U.S. Food and Drug Administration restrictions on marketing cigarettes in the United States will not rule before April 14, the court said Wednesday.

A taped telephone message to advise lawyers and others awaiting U.S. District Court Judge William Osteen's decision said no ruling would come until April 14 or later. A previous message had suggested rulings could come this week.

The tobacco industry claims the federal agency has overstepped its authority by regulating cigarette sales and is unconstitutionally interfering with tobacco companies' free-speech rights by restricting tobacco advertising.
Osteen has been considering the matter since Feb. 10, when tobacco company lawyers asked the judge to throw out the new regulations without a trial. An appeal of Osteen's ruling is highly probable.
